titleStmt.title: Thomas C. Dabney et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11435

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His excellency, The Honorable, Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, your Petitioners would most respectfully State, that William Dudley was during the present term of the Court, found guilty upon an Indictment, for Keeping a Tippling House and a Fine was, assessed against Him for that offense, for Sixty dollars and We being personally acquainted with the Said William Dudley, would State that He is a man with one leg only, and the other Seriously afflicted rendering Him almost entirely Helpless, and, He being, hard pressed to procure a Living. HWe therefore, pray your Excellency to remit Said Fine feeling that in so doing the Ends of Justice would be, fully, attained, We State, that Said Dudley, is a Man wholly without Means or Property.
From information & from Mr Dudley condition his case appeals str strongly to Executive Clemency 20 June 1862

Tho C Dabney
E,, P,, Campbell
G. W Barbour
James S. Lowry
J. C. Barnes
J R Hewlett

William Dudley says on oath that he is wholly without money or property and is deeply afflicted and has but one leg & the other diseased
and is now a subject of the Poor House
Subscribed and sworn before this June 20th 1862

James Cook
A S Lamb
J. M. Ervin
John. W. Woodruff
Joshua. B. Stallins
